title: Image Mosaic Generator
description: A side project I worked on that generates image mosaics from a collection of user-inputted photos or a parsed library of the user's Spotify album covers.

title: Food Bank Smart Routes
description: I built a website for the Root Causes Program at Duke University’s school of Medicine to automate their route generational process, a task they used to spend hours each week performing manually. After spending several months during the summer creating a finished build, I have since been leading their technology division to work on improvements and new features.

title: Noteverse
description: In response to a lack of collaborative note-taking softwares that allowed for both typing and handwriting, I teamed up with my friends to build Noteverse, a cloud-based collaborative note taking software

title: Advanced Dieting
description: At my first hackathon, remembering the frustrating amount of time I spent browsing the internet to find a diet that would work well for me, I came up with the idea for a personalized nutrition app that uses a user’s health history, dietary restrictions, and goals to generate personalized meal plans.

title: Video Frame Interpolation
description: At the Summer Research Academies program (SRA) at UCSB, I worked with my team to built a video classifier to boost the accuracy of existing video frame interpolation architectures. We wrote a paper based on the project which we got published in the Journal of Emerging Investigators.

title: Depth-based Visual Prosthesis
description: At the Research Mentorship Program (RMP) at UCSB, I built a depth-based preprocessing model and tested it in a procedurally generated virtual environment to determine its navigational utility without the use of a physical implant.
